result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan L. Yellowthunder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.  

No contact with L.E.  

No possession of dangerous weapons.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as recommended including Thinking for a Change and Anger Management if deemed necessary.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan L. Yellowthunder

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
15CM1228:
Ct. 2 (BJ)>> Sentence W/H- 18 Months Probation, concurrent to 15CM1386. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommeded including Thinking for a Change and Anger Management if deemed necessary, AODA and follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and drugs, No contact with L.E., No possession of Dangerous weapons, Good faith effort to Maintain Full time work/Full time school, 20 hours Community Service, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge. Defendant is eligible for early discharge from probation if deemed appropriate by agent. No jail credit.

15CM1386:
Ct. 1 (DC-Use of a Dangerous Weapon)>> Sentence W/H- 18 Months Probation, concurrent to 15CM1228. Defendant is eligible for early discharge from probation if deemed appropriate by agent. No jail credit.

Cash bond is to be returned to the poster.

Includes 15CM1228 and 15CM1386.    No contact with victim(s):  L.E.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.   Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.  Shall not consume alcohol.  No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.
